intro: Flagenium farafanganense, commonly known as the Farafanga flagelant, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, elongated, and often pendulous flowers. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its unique floral structure consists of five petals, with the outer ones being larger and more showy. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a significant role in the local ecosystem.
